item.title: Anime Final Quest Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Anime Final Quest monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including cash, draws and much more.

Anime Final Quest is a Roblox action RPG where players take on story missions, fight enemies inspired by popular anime worlds, and build a powerful roster of characters. Instead of running a business or placing structures, players spend their time clearing stages, defeating enemies, and tackling bosses to unlock stronger fighters. Team composition matters heavily, as different characters bring unique skills and strengths to battles.

Progression in this Roblox game depends on resources earned through quest completion, daily activities, and special events. These materials are primarily used for character summons, enhancements, and evolutions that increase overall team power. While steady play rewards consistent progress, redeemable codes provide a shortcut by granting free currency and bonuses, allowing players to summon more characters and strengthen their lineup without sinking hours into repetitive grinding.

Active Anime Final Quest Codes

  • ESCANORSOON
  • SHADOW
  • BOSS
  • UPDATE1

Expired Anime Final Quest Codes

  • RELEASE2
  • RELEASE
  • AFQPEAK
  • AGRIS
  • THXFOR1MVISIT

How To Redeem Anime Final Quest Codes

Like most Roblox games, redeeming codes in Anime Final Quest is easy, and all players need to do is navigate through the menus of the game and input one of the active codes into the correct text box. For players who may be new to the Roblox ecosystem however, here’s a detailed guide to redeeming the codes.

  1. Launch Anime Final Quest on Roblox.
  2. Click on the blue icon on the right side of the screen named Codes.
  3. Copy and/or write the code in the given text box.
  4. Click on confirm to claim the freebie.

How To Get More Anime Final Quest Codes

Anime Final Quest codes are most commonly shared through the game’s official Discord server, the Roblox game page, and occasionally on the developer’s social media channels. The Discord community is particularly active, with developers frequently posting new codes. Therefore, the best place to find new codes is the Anime Final Quest Discord. However, tracking all these platforms can be challenging, especially since there’s no alert system to notify players when codes expire.

Therefore, we recommend bookmarking this guide in your browser, as it is regularly updated with the latest codes and removes expired ones promptly, ensuring you always have access to valid codes.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming Discord Server, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best gem-hunting Roblox games.

If you’re a big fan of Roblox and play a lot of games, you can also check out our code guides for other popular Roblox titles like Steal an Anime, Steal Star Wars, and Mini Empires.

item.title: Bloober Team Says Project M’s Vision ‘Could Only Exist on Nintendo Hardware’
item.content:encoded:
During a new interview, Bloober Team’s CEO revealed some minor details about their Nintendo-exclusive game, Project M.

Bloober Team’s CEO discussed several topics, including bringing Cronos: The New Dawn to Nintendo Switch 2, considering the possibility of their other games coming to the new console, and more. He also revealed that the mysterious Project M is only possible on Nintendo hardware.

Project M has a Twist that No Horror Game has Explored Yet

During a new interview with Nintendo Insider, Bloober Team’s CEO, Piotr Babieno, was asked what players should expect from the Nintendo-exclusive horror game, Project M. Babieno responded, stating that it is very tough for him “not to reveal what Project M truly is—but for now, it’s still too early to talk about it.” However, the developers are confident that they will be able to share the first details “very soon”.

Babieno provided some additional details before wrapping up the Project M topic. The CEO revealed that fans of Resident Evil, Silent Hill, Limbo, and Eternal Darkness will feel immediately at home with this game. Project M will introduce “a bold twist,” which is something that “no horror game has explored before.” Lastly, the “vision” for this game “could only exist on Nintendo hardware”, concluded the Bloober CEO.

In other news, Cronos: The New Dawn will receive an easier difficulty option in early 2026. Additionally, Silent Hill 1 Remake is in full production at Bloober Team. What do you think about Project M’s vision being achievable only on Nintendo hardware? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 devs not being tempted to scale up for their next game. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Realistic Car Driving Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Realistic Car Driving monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Cash and much more.

Realistic Car Driving puts you behind the wheel in an immersive Roblox experience where your driving skills actually matter. Unlike arcade-style games, this simulator emphasizes authentic vehicle physics, challenging players to master realistic handling across diverse terrains and weather conditions. From city streets to off-road trails, each environment demands different techniques as you build your automotive collection. The game revolves around earning cash through various activities – winning races, completing time trials, and participating in driving challenges.

This currency is crucial for expanding your garage with vehicles ranging from everyday commuters to exotic supercars. What keeps players engaged is the depth of progression. Beyond simply acquiring vehicles, you’ll spend hours fine-tuning performance parts, adjusting suspension settings, and applying cosmetic modifications at the customization shops. Although cash is earned through regular gameplay, the fastest way to jump ahead is by redeeming promo codes — developers regularly release codes that grant free cash so players can buy more expensive cars and accelerate their progression instead of grinding. 

Active Realistic Car Driving Codes

  • 375K – 50,000 Cash

Expired Realistic Car Driving Codes

  • 325K
  • 300K
  • 275K
  • THANKYOU
  • ONE
  • 350K

How To Redeem Realistic Car Driving Codes

Follow these steps to activate all the active codes in Realistic Car Driving:

  1. Boot Realistic Car Driving on Roblox
  2. Click on Menu on the top right
  3. Select Codes from the given list
  4. Enter an active code into the text box
  5. Click on Redeem to claim the freebie

How To Get More Realistic Car Driving Codes

Realistic Car Driving codes are typically released through the game’s official community and developer channels, but they don’t appear automatically in-game. The best places to catch them early are the official Discord server and the creator’s (Ferdi26) social media pages, where developers post updates and announcements regularly. Codes often come out around game milestones, major updates, or special events.

But if you’re only checking sporadically, you’ll very easily miss them because no alert system tells players when a code drops. Furthermore, the developers don’t announce expiration dates for codes, making it challenging to know how long each one will remain active. Because of this, the easiest strategy is to save this guide in your browser and check back instead of trying to monitor every source yourself.

This page is refreshed as soon as fresh codes go live, and any codes that have expired are taken out quickly so you always see only the ones that still work.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming Discord Server, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best gem-hunting Roblox games.

If you’re a big fan of Roblox and play a lot of games, you can also check out our code guides for other popular Roblox titles like Steal an Anime, Steal Star Wars, and Mini Empires.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Devs Are Not Tempted to ‘Scale Up’ for their Next Game
item.content:encoded:
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s developer, Sandfall Interactive, is not tempted to scale up after winning Game of the Year.

Sandall Interactive’s Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 ended up winning Game of the Year for 2025, and also ended up breaking an all-time The Game Awards record, which proves how much of a success the title was this year. However, the developers are not looking to expand things instantly, and will keeo things as is for the time being.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Director Says “It’s Good to Have Limitations When You Are Creative”

During a new interview with Edge Magazine (via GamesRadar+), Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s director, Guillaume Broche, was asked whether their next project would become a “large-scale production”. Broche responded, stating, “No, I think it’s good to have limitations when you are creative,” and that it’s the “best way to be the best version of yourself.”

The director added that there is the potential to “scale up now” as the studio has “a lot more money”; however, “I would say it’s not tempting for us because even the management team and myself, we’d have to be hands-on and doing things for ourselves.”

Broche continued, stating that the Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 dev team loves “making games more than we love managing” and wants to continue working on games. These past five years were some of the best of my life, and I want to be happy like that again,” concluded Broche.

In other news, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was disqualified from the Indie Game Awards due to the use of generative AI. Additionally, the game received a major free update recently. What are your thoughts on Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 devs not scaling up for their next game? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed series bringing in the ‘Chernobyl’ director. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Netflix Series Brings in ‘Chernobyl’ Director
item.content:encoded:
A new report reveals that the director of ‘Chernobyl’ is being brought on to helm the upcoming Netflix Assassin’s Creed series.

Things have been progressing rather quickly for Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed series lately. Just last month, players were informed that Toby Wallace from Euphoria has been cast as the lead in the show. There was also a report in November that spoke about the setting of the upcoming series. Now we know who will direct the show, and Netflix has locked in a major name.

Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed Series is ‘Centered on a Secret War Between Two Shadowy Factions’

A new report by Variety reveals that Johan Renck, the Swedish director behind HBO’s highly rated ‘Chernobyl’ series, will be at the helm for Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed. Renck has also directed series like ‘The Last Panther’ and episodes of popular shows like ‘Breaking Bad,’ ‘The Walking Dead,’ ‘Vikings,’ ‘Bates Motel’ and more.

Additionally, Roberto Patino and David Wiener will be the creators, showrunners, and executive producers for Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed adaptation. Gerard Guillemot, Margaret Boykin, Austin Dill, Matt O’Toole, and Genevieve Jones of Ubisoft Film & Television will be coming on as executive producers.

The plot of the upcoming adaptation hasn’t been revealed, but we do have some idea now, thanks to the logline. It states that the series will focus on a secret war between two shadowy factions. One of these factions is “set on determining mankind’s future through control and manipulation, while the other fights to preserve free will.” We all know which two factions the series has always revolved around. ‘

Additionally, the logline also says that Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed series will follow the characters “across pivotal historical events as they battle to shape humanity’s destiny.”

In other news, Assassin’s Creed Black Flag Resynced recently appeared on the PEGI ratings site. Additionally, future games in the series will feature more parkour and potentially dual protagonists again. What are your thoughts on the Chernobyl director directing Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed series? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Call of Duty’s first Nintendo Switch title is ‘nearly done’ according to a new claim. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Call of Duty’s First Nintendo Switch Title is ‘Nearly Done’, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
In February 2023, Microsoft inked a 10-year deal to bring Call of Duty to Nintendo platforms. The deal was signed amidst Microsoft’s landmark acquisition of Activision Blizzard, but fast-forward to today, and the Nintendo space is still without a Call of Duty title.

According to one insider, that might be about to change. In a recent claim posted to social media, it was suggested that Call of Duty is ‘a few months’ away from launching on Nintendo Switch 2.

When is Call of Duty Coming to Switch?

According to Windows Central’s Jez Corden, the first Call of Duty ‘Switch version’ is set to land on the platform in ‘a few months’. Corden explained that the spanner in the works concerned the lack of developer kits for the Nintendo Switch 2, which has been a pretty public issue since before the console launched in June.

Corden didn’t explain which Call of Duty title is being ported to Nintendo Switch 2, leaving it up to fans to surmise what’s on the way. There’s a lengthy line-up to pick from. It could be Call of Duty Warzone, which would promote the fastest adoption on Nintendo Switch 2, or it could be a recent release like Black Ops 6.

Fans aren’t too sure about Black Ops 7 being released on Nintendo Switch 2.

If we were betting people, I think the safest wager would be in the Warzone stakes.

Recently, Sledgehammer Games started hiring for developers with ‘AAA mobile or Nintendo Switch’ experience, which was telling enough.

What Call of Duty title do you think would do well on the Nintendo Switch 2? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that ARC Raiders’ next Expedition window has been confirmed
